title: Big Tech Antitrust Regulatory Capture and Competition Suppression
description: Research how major tech companies (Google, Facebook/Meta, Amazon, Apple, Microsoft) systematically captured regulatory agencies and weakened antitrust enforcement from 1990s-present
research_notes: Focus on tech industry lobbying at FTC/DOJ, revolving door between tech companies and regulators, acquisition strategies to eliminate competitors, and influence on competition policy. Include cases like FTC Google settlement, Facebook acquisitions (Instagram, WhatsApp), Amazon predatory pricing.
next_steps: Research tech industry lobbying expenditures, map career paths between tech companies and antitrust agencies, analyze merger approval patterns and regulatory decisions favoring tech giants
